intro: Crusea wrightii var. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf crusea, is a species of flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, showy white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or wetland habitats. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both ecological studies and ornamental gardening.
